Install a fire-resistant door and windows: These can help prevent the spread of fire and smoke, which can help keep your home safe.
Create a fire break: If your home is located near a fire-prone area, you can create a fire break by digging a trench or clearing a path around your property.
Install a fire extinguisher: Even if all fire-fighting equipment disappeared, having a fire extinguisher on hand can help put out small fires before they get out of control.
Create a fire escape plan: Having a plan in place for how to evacuate your home in case of a fire can help ensure your safety and the safety of your family.
Use natural fire barriers: Certain plants and materials, such as fire-resistant trees and fire-resistant landscaping, can help prevent fires from spreading.
